data.title: The Daily Item
data.meta_description: Ray Cupp passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Daily Item on 2013-06-26.
data.text:
TURBOTVILLE — Ray M. Cupp, 73, of Comley Road, passed away Tuesday, June 25, 2013, at Evangelical Community Hospital, Lewisburg. He was born Oct. 23, 1939, in Williamsport, a son of the late Albert and Hazel (Best) Cupp. He married the former Sandra McCollum on Dec. 23, 1961, and they celebrated 51 years of marriage. Ray retired from Strohmann’s Bakery, Williamsport. He was a member of Zion Evangelical Lutheran Church, Turbotville. Ray enjoyed roller skating, woodworking, baseball, wrestling and youth sports and was a big John Wayne fan. Surviving, in addition to his wife, are two sons and daughters-in-law, Scott M. and Aranda Cupp, of Watsontown, and Rick R. and Melissa Cupp, of Turbotville; two daughters and sons-in-law, Merlene G. and Barry Cox and Crystal L. and Jeff Head, all of Turbotville; two sisters and one brother-in-law, Loretta and Max Hugar, of Montgomery, and Mary Hess, of Williamsport; eight grandchildren, Alisha Welch, Danielle Confer, Summer Cupp, Dillon Cupp, Wesley Cupp, Clarence Cupp, Scotty Cupp and Daytona Cupp; and six great-grandchildren. He was preceded in death by four brothers, Lee, Alvin, James and Harry Cupp, and one sister, Martha Carole. Friends are invited to call from 10 to 11 a.m. Friday at the Brooks Funeral Home, 207 Broadway St., Turbotville, followed by the funeral at 11 with his pastor, the Rev. Erwin C. Roux, officiating. Burial will be private at the convenience of the family. The family suggests contributions in Ray’s memory be made to the American Cancer Society, Central Susquehanna Unit, 1948 E. Third St., Williamsport, PA 17701. Visit www.wfbrooksfuneralhome.com.

Published on June 26, 2013

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentine’s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
